samples.what's the best programming language?:
C# or C++ is a universal language for most things. C++ is the least expensive and the most powerful for a lot of things. C++ was designed to be compatible with the web because it makes you feel good about your code and you just don't know what to do with them.

 It's also useful for writing complex code that doesn't have time to write a full story. It's also great for debugging, which is exactly why you love C++. It's free in the world but you need a specific tooling and you're not going to find it anywhere else.
 C++ is the most open-source programming language in the world — it exists everywhere and you can use it everywhere without worrying about compatibility.
samples.tell me about yourself:

 "Your brain is doing something extraordinary when you know what's happening inside it."
 "That's great" is a very precise description of how incredible it really is. The human brain is a machine with no outside input. It can be more efficient than any computer on earth. You've literally been running your own hardware.


 The human brain is also a weirdly rich system. You can't just fill a book with all the information.
samples.what do you think about AI taking over t:
It's just not a problem — it's a technology that has no answer, which is the only real answer. The world is already doing terrible things at scale — the internet is collapsing, the healthcare system is collapsing, the education system is collapsing, infrastructure is collapsing, and every single service or product that matters to your life is being sold. It's a problem with no solution, which is what it was designed for.

samples.what's the best programming language?:
C++ — it has a massive community of frameworks, built-in debugging tools, and some genuinely interesting behavior. The point is that you build something fast enough to be useful and still write well, which means writing more code often than you should.
 But C++ is also the most abstractly elegant programming language in existence because the specs are so specific it makes the language funkly confusing. It's better than any language in existence, but C++ is more readable than Java or Python.
